intro: Leucanthemum bauhini, commonly known as the white marguerite, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its white petals surrounding a yellow center, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Leucanthemum bauhini is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
